summary: HR Academy is a full-stack Internet Computer (ICP) dapp consisting of a React single-page website (Home, Courses, Gallery, Contact, Admin) backed by a Motoko canister. The canister stores academy content (courses, gallery images, contact info), accepts public submissions (international inquiries and text reviews), and hosts a public gallery of admin-uploaded review screenshots. Administration is protected by Internet Identity authentication plus on-chain role-based access control (RBAC). Images are stored/served as ICP ExternalBlob values and rendered in the frontend via direct gateway URLs. The repository now also includes a reusable build-template (React + Motoko + shadcn/ui) plus image utility scripts to support repeatable builds/deploys and asset maintenance.

existing_features.title: Multi-page public website (SPA) with shared layout
existing_features.description: Provides Home, Courses, Gallery, Contact, and Admin routes using TanStack Router, rendered inside a shared Layout with a sticky Header and a Footer.

existing_features.title: Dark-first red/white/black theme using Tailwind + OKLCH tokens
existing_features.description: Implements a strict brand palette via CSS variables and Tailwind configuration (including accent-red variants) and uses shadcn/ui components for consistent UI styling.

existing_features.title: Canonical brand logo asset used across the site and favicon
existing_features.description: Centralizes the logo path in BRAND_LOGO_PATH ("/assets/HR Academy logo-3.jpeg"), renders it via BrandLogo with eager/high-priority loading and error fallback, and uses the same image for the favicon/preload in index.html.

existing_features.title: Responsive header navigation with prominent Contact Us action
existing_features.description: Header includes BrandLogo, nav links (Home/Courses/Gallery/Contact), a red “Contact Us” button (desktop + mobile), and a mobile Sheet drawer navigation.

existing_features.title: Footer with dynamic contact info and branch locations
existing_features.description: Footer renders BrandLogo, quick links, dynamic contact methods (phone/email/Instagram/Facebook), branch locations, and optional founder/director attribution fetched from backend contact info.

existing_features.title: Home page hero with HR ACADEMY heading and primary CTAs
existing_features.description: Hero section displays the canonical logo, the “HR ACADEMY” heading (restored styling), the “Trusted by 6000+ parents worldwide” tagline, optional founder/director line, and CTA buttons to Courses and Contact plus a WhatsApp quick action.

existing_features.title: Homepage highlights and mission content sections
existing_features.description: Renders a highlight grid (faculty/results/small batches/online math/comprehensive courses) and a mission section with supporting generated images.

existing_features.title: Public course catalog grouped by category
existing_features.description: Fetches courses from the canister and displays them grouped and ordered by category with category-specific badge styling and skeleton loading placeholders.

existing_features.title: Public gallery grid with captions and empty-state placeholders
existing_features.description: Gallery page displays a responsive grid of backend-provided ExternalBlob images (via getDirectURL) with hover captions, skeleton loading, and fallback placeholder images when empty.

existing_features.title: Public contact page with international inquiry form
existing_features.description: Contact page shows contact methods and branch locations, includes an International Students section with WhatsApp consultation link, and provides a form (name, email, country, message) that submits inquiries to the canister with toast feedback.

existing_features.title: Public review submission with star rating and optional anonymity
existing_features.description: Homepage includes a review form allowing optional name, anonymous submissions, and a 1–5 star rating; submissions are sent to the canister and acknowledged with toasts.

existing_features.title: Public review screenshot gallery
existing_features.description: Homepage displays admin-uploaded review screenshot images served by the canister using ExternalBlob direct URLs with optional captions.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication provider
existing_features.description: Provides login/logout and identity session restoration using @dfinity/auth-client; exposes login state flags and errors via React context.

existing_features.title: Per-identity canister actor lifecycle with RBAC initialization
existing_features.description: Creates anonymous actors when logged out and identity-bound actors when logged in; authenticated actor creation triggers _initializeAccessControlWithSecret using a secret token extracted from the URL hash/session.

existing_features.title: Admin dashboard with role-gated access
existing_features.description: Admin route requires Internet Identity login and a canister-admin role (RBAC). Displays a tabbed dashboard for managing courses, gallery images, review screenshots, submitted reviews, and contact info, plus an owner guide.

existing_features.title: Admin content management: courses CRUD
existing_features.description: Admins can add/update/remove courses (id/name/category/description) via the UI; changes invalidate the React Query courses cache.

existing_features.title: Admin content management: gallery image upload and deletion
existing_features.description: Admins can upload gallery images from local files (converted to ExternalBlob bytes) with captions and delete existing images; UI previews images via direct URLs.

existing_features.title: Admin content management: review screenshots and submitted reviews
existing_features.description: Admins can upload/delete review screenshot images and view all submitted text reviews with star-rating display; operations invalidate appropriate React Query caches.

existing_features.title: Admin content management: contact info update
existing_features.description: Admins can update phone, email, WhatsApp URL, Instagram handle, Facebook URL, owner/director name, and branch addresses; updates propagate to public pages via query invalidation.

existing_features.title: Backend RBAC with admin bootstrap token and role APIs
existing_features.description: Motoko RBAC supports admin/user/guest roles, admin-only role assignment, and admin checks. Admin bootstrap is guarded by env token CAFFEINE_ADMIN_TOKEN matched against a user-provided secret during initialization.

existing_features.title: Backend domain APIs for academy content and submissions
existing_features.description: Motoko actor stores courses, gallery images, review screenshot images, submitted reviews, international inquiries, contact info, and user profiles; exposes public getters and admin-gated mutators/list endpoints (e.g., getAllSubmittedReviews, getInternationalInquiries).

existing_features.title: User profile storage and retrieval
existing_features.description: Authenticated users can read/save their own profile; admins can view other users' profiles. Access is enforced via RBAC permissions.

existing_features.title: Blob storage maintenance endpoints (gateway auth, dead-blob pruning, cycles refill)
existing_features.description: Includes canister endpoints to refresh authorized gateway principals, check blob liveness, list/prune dead blobs (with explicit GC trigger), and top up cycles via a cashier principal.

existing_features.title: Reusable build-template scaffold (React+Motoko) with asset maintenance scripts
existing_features.description: Adds a build-template directory containing a reusable ICP project scaffold (frontend+backend config, Docker/deploy tooling, and baseline shadcn/ui component set) along with utility scripts for resizing images and pruning unused images to support repeatable builds and asset maintenance.

architectural_notes: Frontend is a React SPA using TanStack Router for routing and @tanstack/react-query for data fetching, mutations, caching, and cache invalidation.
Backend access is via a generated canister actor; a custom useActor hook recreates the actor when identity changes (anonymous vs authenticated).
Authentication uses Internet Identity via @dfinity/auth-client, wrapped in an InternetIdentityProvider that restores sessions from storage and exposes login state flags.

Admin bootstrap uses a secret token passed via URL hash (caffeineAdminToken) and persisted in sessionStorage for the browser session; the actor calls _initializeAccessControlWithSecret on authenticated creation.
Motoko backend uses Map-based in-memory state for all entities (courses, images, contact info, inquiries, reviews, user profiles) with public read endpoints and admin-gated write/list endpoints.
RBAC is implemented via an AccessControl module plus a Motoko authorization mixin; admin bootstrap requires env var CAFFEINE_ADMIN_TOKEN and a user-provided secret.
Blob-storage functionality is mixed into the canister, exposing dead-blob discovery/pruning, blob liveness checks, gateway principal refresh, and cycles refill via a cashier principal.

Branding is centralized via a canonical logo path constant and a shared BrandLogo component used across Header/Footer/Home and for the favicon; styling uses Tailwind + shadcn/ui with OKLCH CSS-variable tokens.
Backend state (content maps, RBAC roles, user profiles, contact info) is persisted across upgrades using stable storage patterns and upgrade hooks rather than purely in-memory Maps.

Repository includes a build-template scaffold (frontend/backend configs, deploy tooling, baseline shadcn/ui set) plus scripts for resizing/pruning unused images to standardize builds and asset hygiene.
known_issues: AdminPage computes showProfileSetup but does not render any profile setup UI even though backend supports saveCallerUserProfile.
Frontend invalidates ['internationalInquiries'] after submission, but there is no React Query hook/UI to fetch and display inquiries for admins despite backend support (getInternationalInquiries).
useActor invalidates and refetches nearly all queries on actor creation/change, which can cause unnecessary network chatter and UI churn on login/logout.
RBAC initialization depends on CAFFEINE_ADMIN_TOKEN being set; if missing, _initializeAccessControlWithSecret traps and authenticated flows can break.
Blob-storage authorized principals start empty; unless gateway principals are refreshed, blob deletion endpoints will always reject callers as unauthorized.
Contact/query submission email forwarding requested but cannot be implemented until the account/platform email feature is enabled.
